title: US officially withdrawing from World Health Organization
description: The Trump administration has notified Congress and the United Nations that the United States is formally withdrawing from the World Health Organization, multiple officials tell CNN, a move that comes amid a rising number of coronavirus cases throughout the Americas in the last week alone.

title: What we learned from Mary Trump's damning tell-all about Donald Trump
What we learned from Mary Trump's damning tell-all about Donald Trump
description:
• Book: Trump paid someone to take his SATs
• Mary Trump reveals she was NYT source

title: Facebook ad boycott organizers met with Zuckerberg. It didn't go well
description: Civil rights and activist groups blasted Facebook's leadership on Tuesday after meeting with CEO Mark Zuckerberg and other executives to discuss the demands of a large advertiser boycott that now includes hundreds of brands.

title: Contact tracing is no longer possible across the US South
description: Despite hopes for relief this summer, the US is battling the first wave of the Covid-19 pandemic -- so much so that across the South and Southwest contact tracing is no longer possible, according to a health expert.

title: Jimmy John's employees fired for noose video
description: A Jimmy John's sandwich restaurant in Woodstock, Georgia, has fired multiple employees after a video showed them joking around with a noose made from pizza dough.

title: Mary Trump's scathing tell-all book claims Trump paid someone to take his SATs
description: Donald Trump's niece Mary Trump levels scathing criticism of the President in her forthcoming book, accusing him of "hubris and willful ignorance" dating back to his early days.

title: Comedian Rickey Smiley's 19-year-old daughter shot multiple times
description: The 19-year-old daughter of comedian and syndicated radio host Rickey Smiley is currently recovering after being shot during an alleged road rage incident.

title: Brazil's Bolsonaro tests positive for Covid-19
description: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has tested positive for Covid-19, Bolsonaro himself announced, speaking on Brazilian TV channels Tuesday.

title: Man fights off one of the world's deadliest snakes while driving on highway
description: When a traffic officer pulled over a pickup truck on an Australian highway, he didn't expect to find one of the world's deadliest snakes inside.

title: Bubonic plague outbreak prompts crack down on marmot hunting
description: Russian authorities have warned people near the country's border with Mongolia not to hunt or eat marmots after an outbreak of bubonic plague.

title: Tom Hanks gives first TV interview since Covid-19 recovery
description: Having experienced the devastating effects of Covid-19 firsthand, Tom Hanks is urging people to do their part in preventing the virus from spreading even further.

title: US Sen. who lost her legs serving in Iraq slams Tucker Carlson for saying she hates America
description: Democratic Sen. Tammy Duckworth, a US Army veteran who lost both of her legs while serving in Iraq, rebuked Tucker Carlson after the conservative Fox News host attacked her on Monday night and suggested that she hates America.

title: Secret torture site discovered in shipping containers
description: Authorities in the Netherlands have discovered an apparent torture site hidden inside shipping containers, which were lined with sound-proofing material and filled with assumed torture devices, the country's National Prosecutor's Office has said.

title: Florida jogger finds decomposing human head on side of the road
description: A woman out for a run in St. Petersburg, Florida, came across a decomposing human head on the side of the road on Tuesday, according to police.

title: See Florida governor's response to critical virus question
description: In a press conference, Florida Gov. Ron Desantis and Miami-Dade County mayor Carlos Giménez were pushed by a reporter on contract tracers after there was confusion over whether the governor or mayor could hire contact tracers during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: FBI director unleashes on China in speech
description: Chinese hackers have moved swiftly to target US pharmaceutical and research institutions making progress in the fight against coronavirus, FBI Director Christopher Wray said Tuesday in a wide-ranging speech that included some of the agency's starkest accusations about the country's threat to the US to date.

title: Can the AC filter in your home, office or local mall protect you from Covid-19?
description: When New York Governor Andrew Cuomo announced last week that malls in New York could not reopen until they installed high-efficiency particulate air filters capable of trapping the virus that causes Covid-19, Harvard environmental health researcher Joseph Gardner Allen was thrilled.

title: I got Covid-19 two months ago. I'm still discovering new areas of damage
description: The cough has come back, without warning and seemingly for no reason; so has the fatigue. True, neither are as debilitating as when I had the actual virus, but they are back.

title: Trump to travel to coronavirus hotspot
description: President Donald Trump is expected to travel to Doral, Florida, later this week, landing squarely in the center of a coronavirus hotspot and taxing the already limited local health resources.

title: Man describe fighting off snake whilst driving
description: Police in Queensland, Australia have pulled over a speeding driver who says he was rushing to hospital after he fought off one of the world's deadliest snakes while driving on the highway.

title: Deutsche Bank fined $150M for failing to flag Epstein's shady transactions
description: New York regulators fined Deutsche Bank $150 million Tuesday and slammed the lender for "mistakes and sloppiness" in its relationship with accused sex-trafficker Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Lin-Manuel Miranda responds to 'Hamilton' slavery criticism
description: Disney+ has scored a hit with the filmed version of "Hamilton," but that success has renewed discussion about how the musical deals with the slaveholders it portrays.

title: US outbreak is so bad that contact tracing is no longer possible across the South: expert
Over 1 million international students in the US may be forced to leave. Here's where they're from
Newly appointed French minister faces rape allegations
description: France's newly appointed interior minister Gerald Darmanin could face a fresh investigation into an alleged rape following a court ruling, sources close to the case told CNN on Tuesday.

title: East Wing braces for upcoming book by former Melania Trump aide
description: The East Wing is bracing for the upcoming book by Stephanie Winston Wolkoff, titled, "Melania and Me," a source familiar with the situation tells CNN.

title: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro tests positive for coronavirus
Former Kasabian frontman pleads guilty to assaulting ex-fiancee
description: The former frontman of British rock band Kasabian has pleaded guilty to assaulting his ex-fiancee -- a day after it was announced he was quitting the band over "personal issues."

title: Australia's second-largest city to be locked down for six weeks to curb second wave
description: Strict lockdown measures are to be reimposed in Australia's second largest city, as authorities scramble to prevent a second wave of coronavirus infections spreading across the country.

title: Covid-19 closed this border for the first time in 100 years
description: Australia has closed the border between the states of Victoria and New South Wales in a bid to control a coronavirus outbreak in Victoria. Strict lockdown measures will also be reimposed in Australia's second largest city and Victoria's capital, Melbourne.

title: America's passport is now as weak as Mexico's
description: Before Covid-19 struck, the world was enjoying greater freedom of movement than at any time in history.

title: Trump's risky nose-to-nose challenge to China in the South China Sea
description: Donald Trump managed to avoid touching off a forest fire in the tinder-dry forest around Mount Rushmore with his Independence Day fireworks display, but instead his administration seems to be doing its best to set Asia on fire in the South China Sea.

title: China investing billions in chipmaking to close the gap with global rivals
description: China's largest semiconductor maker could raise as much as $7.5 billion this year by listing its stock in Shanghai — a move that could deliver the Chinese mainland its largest share sale in a decade, and reduce the country's reliance on foreign chips.

title: How airplanes fill up with fuel mid-air
description: Imagine you're zooming down the highway at 70 miles per hour and the car's fuel gauge is on its way to empty.

title: Luxury train hotel permanently stuck on a bridge
description: Though luxury hotel openings have slowed to a trickle this year due to the Covid-19 pandemic, there are still a few exciting new properties opening their doors to guests in 2020.

title: Masks are effective only if you wear them properly. Here's the right (and wrong) way
description: So, about masks -- they do next to nothing if you don't wear them properly.

title: The ugly truth about millions of US jobs
description: The American economy's unprecedented jobs rebound masks a difficult truth: For millions of people, the jobs they lost are never coming back.

title: Covid-19 kept them from their pets for months. So they've chartered a plane to bring them home
description: In May, Kyla Robertson was trying to find a way to bring Sugar home.

title: Tottenham boss praises 'beautiful' spat between two of his players
description: Tottenham manager Jose Mourinho says the clash between his captain Hugo Lloris and forward Son Heung-min was "beautiful," as his side beat Everton 1-0 in the Premier League on Monday.

title: US is considering a ban on TikTok and other Chinese social media apps, Pompeo says
White parents: Talk to your kids about racism to raise more empathic adults
description: Though race and racism are at the top of Americans' public discussion, most white parents don't talk about those issues with their kids.

title: Citizens collectively ring pots when this world leader goes on TV
description: In the age of Covid-19, President Donald Trump and Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro are two of a kind. CNN's Bill Weir reports on how the US and Brazil lead the world in the number of cases while their leaders downplay coronavirus.

title: Siberia had its warmest June ever as wildfires raged and carbon dioxide emissions surged
description: An estimated 59 megatonnes of carbon dioxide were released across Siberia in June by wildfires raging across the vast Russian region, according to scientists at the Copernicus Atmosphere Monitoring Service (CAMS).

title: Halle Berry apologizes and is no longer considering a transgender role in upcoming film
description: After facing backlash on social media, actress Halle Berry announced on Twitter Monday she is no longer considering portraying a transgender man in an upcoming film role.

title: Anderson Cooper: Trump wants you to suck it up as thousands die
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper slams President Donald Trump's comment that coronavirus is "99% harmless" while the number of cases in the US continue to rise.

title: Top Obama strategist explains why Trump's tactics aren't working
description: White House press secretary Kayleigh McEnany refused to denounce the Confederate flag during a press briefing after President Donald Trump bemoaned NASCAR's recent decision to ban it from all races and events. CNN's David Axelrod analyzes Trump's strategy of stoking racial divide in the nation to gain re-election.
